intro: Euphrasia ramosa, commonly known as the hairy eyebright, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family, characterized by its small, delicate flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and meadows. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are usually yellow or reddish with five petals. Euphrasia ramosa is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
